title: lack of punishment for griefing
body:
so i just got to plat 4 promos with a 75% winrate. at which point, my jungle ran down mid from min 1 then left, then my adc admitted to griefing, then my top and mid both inted and rage quit. 3 games in a row, 3 games lost due to blatant griefing, i was given a chat restriction for flaming them for losing my promos, but riot won't even do the courtesy of rewatching the games, instead leaving it all to an automated chat filter system. the smallest of indy companies at work

UPDATE: my mental has snapped and i have now griefed for several hours straight. people can admit to griefing in chat without being banned, i wonder if the same is true for the forums

In the eyes of the automated tribunal, moderators and Riot employees alike, everyone is expected to have the patience, wisdom, and discipline of a buddhist monk when dealing with legitimately toxic players who's sole purpose is to treat everyone else poorly. Riot likes to think that the majority of their players (at least the ones with the most time invested) are not toxic in any way, shape or form and use this as a foundation with which to judge people. They further like to think that their system prevents people from being toxic, which it definitely does not. People get banned, make a new account but this time they are angrier and have a more cynical approach to the game in general.

Eventually these people figure out ways to be JUST toxic enough to fly under the radar and never get punished. However, you get punished for replying to them, even if there was no profanity used. If you spend any time at all talking instead of playing the game, you become a griefer to the players who originally griefed you. I've gotten a chat suspension for ONLY replying to people while I was dead with no profanity.

My solution? I edited the text file that holds game settings to have my chat scale be -100 or something like that so I never see a single thing anyone else says. My end result is that I stay 100% more focused to the map and pings and overall I play much better.

The only con I have is that sometimes I think I have the chat window open and end up using my summs but hey, least I don't deal with the toxicity of other players anymore.

What do you mean, that banning toxic players makes more people toxic?

I used to play a mmo a few years ago. It was called mabinogi, and we didn't really have a report function and reporting players was quite difficult.

Overall the atmosphere was chill. Sure we had people cursing and assholes, but it wasn't to bad.
and honestly it was quite friendly game.

Then they introduced vindictus, which was another mmo but based on action gameplay. And at the start it was sort of ok. 
Then they introduced a report function on forums. And that game turned into a bunch of elitists and crybabies.
The "toxicity" skyrocketed.
and compared with the other mmo I was playing it was a huge difference.

To put it simply, if you allow easy reporting, people will report almost anything and the general social fabric will degrade.
-------------------------------------
LoL was or still is reknown as the most toxic game community.

And honestly the fault for this doesn't belong with just the community. I don't see how this game would attract only the worst people out there.
But I do see decisions made by riot that would encourage bad behavior.

Yes, you have people that are frustrated with trolls, afks, intentional feeders, people intentionally trying to make them lose who don't even get punished, yet soon as they say something they get punished. Anyone is going to be more frustrated and upset when you take away their ability or punish them for expressing how they feel. less people would feel upset if you just let people express themselves and let the ones who don't want to hear it just use the mute button. If riot tried that for a month I bet that they would see a large amount of players reduce their anger and toxicity. Yea you would still have the group that are just ragers but you will always have that. It's human nature sometimes people just need to blow off a little steam and if you don't want to hear it just mute them. However banning the players does not get rid of them, and riot knows this, that's why they don't restrict a single account to an email, players buy or create another account and come back even more angry and upset. Riot isn't addressing the underlying problem they are just putting a band-aid on a sunburn it isn't even using the right solution. 

If riot punished the griefers, afkers, quitters, trolls, intent feeders, and people who make you intentionally lose. I mean going after them really heavy, you watch how quickly your community would see it's toxicity levels drop, that plus allowing people to express themselves would do wonders. I have been playing this game since season one and yes more people have joined since then, but the toxicity only gets worse every season, and yes I get that will grow with a growing game and yes there were toxic players before but not to this level, and the harder the ban hammer the more toxicity and trolling I notice.

I mean that when you ban people for being toxic in chat the people who still want to be toxic find other, often times worse, ways of being toxic to their team. Examples are inting, afking, and trolling.

I actually kinda get this. 

Players understand that they cant drop N-bombs or talk about Korean Maplestory in game, so they take their anger out in other ways instead. 
Like intentionally overextending and AFK pushing knowing it gets them killed, and the other behaviors OP experienced. 

There's no leniency for 'toxicity' and it ends up with an extreme leniency for behaviors that ACTUALLY NEGATIVELY IMPACT OUTCOMES, rather than the mental state of the players. Don't get me wrong, I'm glad Riot punishes as hard as they do, although it's not a perfect system either (No punishment forgiveness for instance. If you get a 2 week ban at any point, for any reason, your next punishment is GUARANTEED Permanent and there's nothing you can do about it, even if you havent been punished in 4 **years**.) Aside from a few tweaks, every time someone goes online to complain about being perma'd, they post chat logs and they absolutely deserved it. 
But 8, 9 years or so of punishing toxicity hasn't done much for making League less toxic, now has it?

You know... I spent over 2 years explaining this exact type of thing with detailed EVIDENCE and got nothing but grief from the boards.
I could still be playing despite having gotten chat restricted a couple times for losing my temper over seeing that type of crap over and over and nothing being done about it, but I'm done with it.

I applaud anyone who will still fight for the idea that Riot needs to step up to the plate and actually start dealing with griefing instead of excusing it. I'm happy to see that for once the boards are upvoting such a post rather than spam downvoting and writing mindless stupid replies that show they didn't even bother reading half of what you wrote like I've faced for over 2 years campaigning to fix this issue.

But until I see meaningful improvement in the way they treat players and the way they deal with griefing, I refuse to play anymore. Sad because I just found an irl friend who actually plays lol about a year ago, but playing the game even just for fun with them suggest that I support their horrible lazy policy in regards to griefing and their overly harsh policy towards "toxicity" which can be muted. Funny how toxicity of griefing which cannot be muted is not only ignored, but outright defended and excused by Riot while anything explicit in chat gets brought to the gallows even if it was deserved based on what was done and said to the player who snapped from being repeatedly abused both in chat and by gameplay such as your griefing teammates.

Best of luck to you, but I don't see anything changing any time soon.
